subtitle: Crisp biscuits with a fruity, spicy taste.

method.text: Heat the oil in a frying pan. Remove from heat. Add lemon peel, sesame seeds and aniseed. Transfer mixture to a bowl. Allow to cool completely.
Remove the lemon peel. Stir in the wine, lemon and orange rind and caster sugar.
Sift together the flour and cinnamon. Gradually beat in the seed mixture to form a stiff dough. Knead the mixture until smooth. Wrap the mixture in cling film. Chill for 30 min.

Divide the chilled dough into 16 pieces and shape each one into a flat round biscuit. Place them on lightly greased baking sheets. Brush the tops with egg white. Sprinkle over the chopped almonds. Bake for 20-25 min or until golden.
Transfer biscuits to a wire tray to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 weeks.

title: Sesame and aniseed biscuits
